etymologies: Old English -sprǣdan (used in combinations), of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch spreiden and German spreiten

definitions: open out (something) so as to extend its surface area, width, or length

examples.text: I spread a towel on the sand and sat down
she helped Chris to spread out the map

shortDefinitions: open out something so as to extend its surface area or length

definitions: stretch out (arms, legs, hands, fingers, or wings) so that they are far apart

examples.text: the swan spread its wings

shortDefinitions: stretch out so that they are far apart

definitions: extend over a large or increasing area

examples.text: she stood at the window looking at the town spread out below

shortDefinitions: extend over large or increasing area

definitions: (of a group of people) move apart so as to cover a wider area

examples.text: the Marines spread out across the docks

shortDefinitions: move apart so as to cover wider area

definitions: distribute or disperse (something) over a certain area

examples.text: volcanic eruptions spread dust high into the stratosphere

shortDefinitions: distribute or disperse something over area

definitions: gradually reach or cause to reach a larger and larger area or more and more people

examples.text: the violence spread from the city to the suburbs
she's always spreading rumors about other people

shortDefinitions: gradually reach or cause to reach wider area or more people

definitions: (of people, animals, or plants) become distributed over a large or larger area

examples.text: the owls have spread as far north as Yellowknife

shortDefinitions: become distributed over large or larger area

definitions: distribute (something) in a specified way

examples.text: you can spread the payments over as long a period as you like

shortDefinitions: distribute in specified way

definitions: apply (a substance) to an object or surface in an even layer

examples.text: he sighed, spreading jam on a croissant

shortDefinitions: apply substance to object or surface in even layer

definitions: cover (a surface) with a substance in an even layer

examples.text: spread each slice thinly with mayonnaise

shortDefinitions: cover surface with substance in even layer

definitions: be able to be applied in an even layer

examples.text: the whipped butter spreads easily

shortDefinitions: be able to be applied in even layer

definitions: lay (a table) for a meal.
shortDefinitions: lay table for meal

definitions: the fact or process of spreading over an area

examples.text: warmer temperatures could help reduce the spread of the disease
the spread of the urban population into rural areas

shortDefinitions: fact or process of spreading over area

definitions: the extent, width, or area covered by something

examples.text: the male's antlers can attain a spread of six feet

shortDefinitions: extent, width, or area covered by something

definitions: the wingspan of a bird

examples.text: the red-tailed hawk has a four-and-a-half-foot spread

shortDefinitions: wingspan of bird

definitions: an expanse or amount of something

examples.text: the green spread of the park

shortDefinitions: expanse or amount of something

definitions: a large farm or ranch.
shortDefinitions: large farm or ranch

definitions: the range or variety of something

examples.text: a wide spread of ages

shortDefinitions: range or variety of something

definitions: the difference between two rates or prices

examples.text: the very narrow spread between borrowing and deposit rates

shortDefinitions: difference between two rates or prices

definitions: a soft paste that can be applied in a layer to bread or other food

examples.text: low-fat spreads
cheese spread

shortDefinitions: soft paste that can be applied in layer to bread

definitions: an article or advertisement covering several columns or pages of a newspaper or magazine, especially one on two facing pages

examples.text: a double-page spread

shortDefinitions: article or advertisement covering several columns or pages of newspaper or magazine

definitions: a large and impressively elaborate meal

examples.text: his mother laid on a huge spread

shortDefinitions: large and impressively elaborate meal

definitions: a bedspread

examples.text: a patchwork spread

shortDefinitions: bedspread
